dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependent_to.name: arbor
dependent_to.description:
Arbor is a high-performance library for computational neuroscience
simulations.

dependent_to.name: root
dependent_to.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependent_to.name: py-tweedledum
dependent_to.description:
tweedledum is a library for synthesis, compilation, and optimization of
quantum circuits. The library is written to be scalable up to problem
sizes in which quantum circuits outperform classical ones. Also, it is
meant to be used both independently and alongside established tools.

dependent_to.name: xeus
dependent_to.description: QuantStack C++ implementation of Jupyter kernel protocol

dependent_to.name: prmon
dependent_to.description: Standalone monitor for process resource consumption.

dependent_to.name: xwidgets
dependent_to.description: A C++ backend for Jupyter interactive widgets

dependent_to.name: nlohmann-json-schema-validator
dependent_to.description: JSON schema validator for JSON for Modern C++

dependent_to.name: acts
dependent_to.description:
A Common Tracking Software (Acts) This project contains an experiment-
independent set of track reconstruction tools. The main philosophy is to
provide high-level track reconstruction modules that can be used for any
tracking detector. The description of the tracking detector's geometry
is optimized for efficient navigation and quick extrapolation of tracks.
Converters for several common geometry description languages exist.
Having a highly performant, yet largely customizable implementation of
track reconstruction algorithms was a primary objective for the design
of this toolset. Additionally, the applicability to real-life HEP
experiments plays major role in the development process. Apart from
algorithmic code, this project also provides an event data model for the
description of track parameters and measurements. Key features of this
project include: tracking geometry description which can be constructed
from TGeo, DD4Hep, or GDML input, simple and efficient event data model,
performant and highly flexible algorithms for track propagation and
fitting, basic seed finding algorithms.

dependent_to.name: gitconddb
dependent_to.description:
Conditions Database library using a Git repository as the storage
backend

dependent_to.name: gaudi
dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework

dependent_to.name: openpmd-api
dependent_to.description: C++ & Python API for Scientific I/O

dependent_to.name: paraview
dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application. This package includes the Catalyst in-situ
library for versions 5.7 and greater, otherwise use the catalyst
package.

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-aer
dependent_to.description:
Aer is a high performance simulator for quantum circuits that includes
noise models

dependent_to.name: mrchem
dependent_to.description:
MRChem is a numerical real-space code for molecular electronic structure
calculations within the self-consistent field (SCF) approximations of
quantum chemistry: Hartree-Fock and Density Functional Theory.
